text: Earlier today, I had an opportunity to review some of Supreme Court nominee Kavanaugh's documents that the Republicans have kept from the American people. Given the enormous stakes around Judge Kavanaugh’s nomination, these documents should be made public immediately.
Thank you to the men and women whose hard work and ingenuity, day in and out, power our nation’s economy. #LaborDay

Handing over 42,000 more pages just hours before hearings begin is not transparency—it’s an effort to undermine the Senate’s ability to fully advise and consent. This is more reason to wait until all the documents are released before holding hearings. https://t.co/OHGtY9yr8t
I stand with my colleagues on the Senate Judiciary Committee in demanding the release of Judge Kavanaugh’s full White House record before his confirmation moves forward.

One year ago, @realDonaldTrump rescinded #DACA—pulling the rug out from under hundreds of thousands of Dreamers. Since then, he has blocked all legislative attempts to fix the crisis he created. It’s far past time to bring certainty back into these young peoples’ lives.

The rush and secrecy of the Kavanaugh hearings has left us to wonder what the White House is withholding from the American people. With @SenCortezMasto, led 19 senators to support @JudiciaryDems in calling on the WH to make Kavanaugh’s complete record public. https://t.co/HGVr53Mb3e

We will #NeverForget the innocent lives lost 17 years ago. We honor the loss, sacrifice, and service by defending the American values that were attacked that day. It's our shared commitment to those values that will keep our republic strong.
I will vote “No” on Supreme Court nominee Judge Kavanaugh. Here’s why: https://t.co/EE6MqjSiFK

EPA’s decision is so senseless & damaging. Every American who wants clean air for their kids should be concerned. We shouldn’t disadvantage states like Colorado, Utah & California that have stepped up to pass more protective standards. What good reason is there to lower the bar? https://t.co/UAVLeCHbX7

Colorado Springs named the best city for veterans to live: https://t.co/KLLOmkXjiF

Thanks to @MilitaryTimes for recognizing CO as a great place for veterans and their families to work, live, and retire.

Congratulations to leaders across Northern Colorado who fought for years to expand I-25. They have done the work we so often fail today to do: maintain the roads & bridges that our grandparents had the decency to maintain for us. Washington could learn from their example. https://t.co/Z66gSv2TO4

Colorado has a proud history of responsible energy development on public lands. @BLM_CO should listen to local input when considering oil and gas lease sales & defer the parcels that @GovofCO and communities have requested. https://t.co/zwPgVF6KlC

LIVE on the Senate Floor: @realDonaldTrump has spent the last few months touting the strong economy. Let’s take a look at the story the numbers really tell. Tune in on Facebook now --> https://t.co/3XYw8Gjap2
In recent months, @realDonaldTrump has touted the strength of the economy, saying: “You just have to look at the numbers.” Let’s do that.

It’s a busy Thursday morning in DC: Just met with @RMFUnion in my office & am headed to a Senate Agriculture hearing where I’ll question @USTradeRep about how @POTUS’ trade policies are affecting our agriculture communities. Tune in here: https://t.co/XvAxQl8A2b https://t.co/Te3Rgel2wp

This is how @realDonaldTrump responds to a hurricane. Several reports have laid bare the incompetence of his reaction to Hurricane Maria. We’ve already faced enormous tragedy in Puerto Rico. We cannot repeat this. https://t.co/VwOwMiPjB5
A real strategy on China would strengthen our alliances, not provoke a trade war. https://t.co/vjnLswYzA9

Too many politicians wrongly suggest that we need to make people’s lives harder to motivate them to build something better. The result: tens of millions of Americans' lives are too unstable to thrive no matter how hard they try. Compelling @NYTmag piece: https://t.co/RAl4JwQe6F

The Senate should not move forward  w/ Judge Kavanaugh's nomination until the Judiciary Committee conducts a full investigation into these serious allegations. This is a lifetime appointment to one of the most powerful positions in government. We owe the American people no less.

Dr. Ford should be given the opportunity to testify before the Senate Judiciary Committee. It takes great courage to come forward with her story. We should listen to her and conduct a full investigation into the allegations.

Disgraceful. Slashing the cap to historic lows & denying refuge to those fleeing the very evils we seek to counter contradicts our proud history of being a beacon of hope and opportunity for the world. https://t.co/k6YW3D4ViN

We should be building coalitions to apply pressure to China. Reckless tariffs open up our farmers, ranchers & workers to even further retaliation. When is @POTUS going to recognize we need a strategic plan to address China’s unfair trade practices, not an unpredictable trade war? https://t.co/6lB4leShcC

Tonight we passed legislation to combat the #opioidcrisis ravaging communities across the country. Although a step in the right direction, we must keep doing more to limit the flow of opioids while investing in resources to treat those struggling w/ substance use disorders.

Disappointed to learn BLM did not listen to Coloradans & went ahead w/ #methanerule rollback even after Senate rejected it. This will lead to more pollution, waste more natural gas & decrease revenue for taxpayers. Worst of all, it will put the health of our communities at risk.
NEWS: @USArmy will stand up a Stryker Brigade Combat Team at Fort Carson. This could not be a better decision for our national security, for our Army, and for Colorado.

Both Dr. Ford & Ms. Ramirez have said they are willing to provide their accounts to the FBI under oath. Anyone who is disputing their accounts should also be willing to do so under oath. The nomination process should not move forward until the FBI investigates these allegations.

For years, we’ve been working to permanently reauthorize & fully fund the Land & Water Conservation Fund. There isn’t a county in the country without an #LWCF project. Now we’re days away from the program expiring once again. #SaveLWCF https://t.co/4FBdeOqNuj

We need an FBI investigation. The 3 women who have come forward have put themselves & their families at risk and are willing to testify under oath. Anyone who refutes or seeks to discredit these claims should be willing to talk to the FBI.
The Senate should not vote on Judge Kavanaugh’s nomination until the FBI fully investigates all of these allegations.
Merrick Garland’s seat was held open for more than 400 days. What’s the rush?
We can’t ignore the facts: #cleanenergy is creating jobs & boosting our state’s economy. Thanks @E2org for your work to promote clean jobs. #CleanEnergyWeek https://t.co/UvIO3xNwbq
Congratulations to Coloradan Malachi Haynes on being named @BGCA_Clubs National Youth of the Year. What an incredible & deserved honor. #NYOY18 #COProud https://t.co/pMkik8rkfV
https://t.co/bLtcKjZKXB
If @senatemajldr can hold open a Supreme Court vacancy for more than 400 days, the FBI can surely spend the time required for a formal investigation.

Appreciate effort by @JeffFlake @lisamurkowski @ChrisCoons @Sen_JoeManchin to delay the vote and allow for an FBI investigation. This is one small but important step toward restoring our responsibility to advise and consent. The FBI must thoroughly investigate the allegations.

Today is the first National Urban Wildlife Refuge Day, celebrating our nation's foresight to conserve wild places like Rocky Mountain Arsenal, which Coloradans can easily access from cities to hike & explore. Resolution I introduced with @SenToomey → https://t.co/8vffzDVCfi https://t.co/ZaL7ETQOp4

Latest on Trump Admin marijuana committee: @ONDCP commits to present objective marijuana info to the public & I intend to hold them to this promise. Government-sponsored propaganda shouldn’t undermine use of fact-based data to inform marijuana policy: https://t.co/sKgGNTL0rN

The expiration last night of a widely popular program like #LWCF demonstrates just how broken Washington is. If we don’t want to find ourselves in this exact position again down the road, we must permanently reauthorize & fully fund this critical conservation tool.

In Senate Agriculture Committee, we crafted a bipartisan #FarmBill that included CO priorities & received 86 votes on the floor. While the House continues to try to pass their partisan bill, we'll work to send a strong, bipartisan Farm Bill to @POTUS' desk as soon as possible.

It’s rich for @SenMajLdr to admonish for delay. He is the master of delay.
cc: Merrick Garland https://t.co/DfHiu2UtZz
LIVE: Speaking on the Senate floor about Judge Kavanaugh's nomination. Watch here → https://t.co/UvNGP0n2l5

I worry what Kavanaugh’s confirmation will mean for Coloradans. 
For those w/ preexisting conditions. 
For kids w/ asthma amid pollution.
For same-sex couples. 
For women w/ a right to make their own health care decisions.
For survivors of sexual assault bravely coming forward.

If we still had a 60-vote threshold, it’s hard to imagine the Senate moving forward with Kavanaugh’s nomination w/o disclosing his full record. Without giving the minority time to review that record. Without a thorough & complete FBI investigation that interviewed all witnesses.

We have exported the mindless, empty, counterproductive, unimaginative, meaningless partisanship from the floor of the Senate to the United States Supreme Court. We should be ashamed that we’re doing that to an independent branch of our government.
To Debbie Ramirez: We hear you. Thank you for so bravely coming forward and inspiring others to do the same. https://t.co/DOxDv14lEo
Today I voted against Judge Kavanaugh's confirmation to the United States Supreme Court. Here's why: https://t.co/n5wlFWweVG

This week’s scientific @IPCC_CH report could not be more clear: We must take immediate, global action to combat #climatechange. Colorado is already up against wildfires & persistent drought. Our communities & economies depend on our willingness to act.  https://t.co/khvYkQGzgE

Congratulations to American economists William Nordhaus and Paul Romer. Their contributions to addressing #climatechange & the promotion of effective climate policy are immeasurable. https://t.co/cl42QSRTm6

Health insurance should not be a scam. Forcing families to choose between affordability and essential services—like ER visits and prescription drugs—is a false choice. That’s why I’m joining @SenatorBaldwin to protect Coloradans’ health insurance & roll back #JunkPlans. https://t.co/eNlzlCOvm6

Building communities where kids can learn & grow is one of the fundamental promises of our government. Taking away health care from 48,000 kids in Colorado & sending even more to school hungry is an abdication of that responsibility & decency. https://t.co/Q44M5zKcrQ

Given serious allegations that Saudi officials murdered journalist Jamal Khashoggi, @stevenmnuchin1 should not extend the backing of Treasury Dept to efforts promoting investment in Saudi Arabia. He should withdraw from the Riyadh investment conference. https://t.co/uYItcKL8vQ

There is no credible reason to weaken our nation’s methane standards. That’s why 21 of my colleagues and I just sent a letter urging the @EPA to halt this rollback until it provides information justifying their proposed changes. https://t.co/5SRHXjMbCB

Political & business leaders across the world have withdrawn from the Riyadh conference following the death of @washingtonpost journalist Jamal Khashoggi. It’s time Treasury Sec @stevemnuchin1 does the same. 
https://t.co/nkIctbdXSq
Just as predicted: @SenMajLdr is planning to cut Social Security, Medicare & Medicaid in order to fund his tax cut for the wealthiest Americans. https://t.co/S3YNUuyMtT

.@RonWyden and I called for Sec Mnuchin to withdraw from the Riyadh conference a week ago. This is a step, but far from a sufficient response. The Administration should be using all levers of influence to uncover answers about Khashoggi’s disappearance. https://t.co/wZJjJruNfn

You can’t have it both ways—celebrating the decrease in U.S carbon pollution while rolling back environmental regulations. This decrease is because of economic opportunity from #cleanenergy. Trump admin needs to invest in an energy future that boosts our economy & public health. https://t.co/XNl3oMcshp

Good news: @POTUS signed into law our bill to help protect Colorado from invasive mussels. This will bolster state efforts to prevent the spread of aquatic invasive species, which pose a serious threat to our water infrastructure, environment, and economy. https://t.co/JQn5Ulbyqk

The bipartisan opioids bill that @POTUS signed into law today is a step in the right direction, but far from enough. We must keep working on meaningful policies that reflect the magnitude of the #opioidcrisis ravaging communities. https://t.co/7tzFMFMEGY

It's hard to believe what @POTUS reads from a teleprompter when we see how he really feels each day on his Twitter feed, stoking fear and division for political gain. A genuine effort to unify this country requires so much more. https://t.co/Md2Gjy0E9h

At @ColoradoMesaU this week, the U.S. Court of Appeals heard oral arguments in Western Colorado for the first time in history. Educational opportunities like this are at the heart of preparing the next generation of civic-minded leaders. https://t.co/78AWJFTWaA

Gun violence, fear-mongering & anti-Semitism have no place in our communities—let alone our places of worship. My prayers are with the Tree of Life Synagogue as they confront this devastating attack. I echo Pennsylvania Gov Wolf: We've been saying "one too many" for too long. https://t.co/utrHciqsU0

Frisco resident Karen’s leadership is a testament to her love for her husband, who died in a 2015 helicopter crash, & the reason this law to improve safety standards became a reality. It's a true example of how government can be responsive to its citizens. https://t.co/qH20SEnUxy

Congratulations to Denver & Fort Collins as they work to improve air quality and rental housing efficiency in our communities. We need to see more of these local, innovative approaches to combat the health and economic consequences of #climatechange. https://t.co/fxVUMiXEVy

The direction of our nation is at stake: It’s the difference between a United States that is home to Dreamers who know no other country, or a United States that rips children away from their parents at the border in the name of the American people. https://t.co/qn4CAbwiE5

The national security adviser called the national debt a threat to society. I agree, so why did your economic team pass a massive, deficit-busting tax cut?
https://t.co/povti7ctJQ
This could not be more false. Republicans have tried to repeal the Affordable Care Act—which includes protections for preexisting conditions—63 times. https://t.co/QwqbykL24l

Mark your calendars: Open enrollment starts TODAY. This is your chance to sign up or re-enroll in a health care plan. You can #GetCovered through December 15 at https://t.co/JtV0rjiqz7 https://t.co/nMq8Pvl7YV

Appreciate @BLM_CO thoughtful decision to listen to Coloradans & defer parcels from Dec oil & gas lease sale. @GovofCO & I worked in lockstep to put local input at center of process. We’ll keep working to balance responsible energy development w/other natural resource priorities.

Our institutions are being tested. The Senate Majority must stand up for the rule of law instead of cowering from its responsibility as an independent check on this President and his effort to undermine the Mueller investigation. https://t.co/W2oxwv97Lg

Our kids should be able to go to a bar without the fear of being shot down. My heart breaks for parents & loved ones of those killed in LA. Americans sent a message Tues by electing officials who support background checks & other measures to end gun violence. We must take action.
We're live from the Capitol steps in Denver tonight because nobody is above the law. Tune in: https://t.co/hnx3hB85yk

This is not a country where the President is above the law. That’s what separates us from other countries, and that’s worth fighting for. We must protect the Mueller investigation. #ProtectMueller https://t.co/guPYfOBP2t
In the Mueller investigation, 35 defendants have faced charges. 8 individuals have been found guilty & 4 are behind bars. This is not a “witch hunt” or “fake news.” #ProtectMueller

It’s up to all of us to fulfill our civic responsibility and stand up for the rule of law. Thank you to the thousands of Americans who are standing up tonight at rallies across the country. #ProtectMueller https://t.co/5C0v8vZ3nv

Thank you to our nation's veterans. B/c of your service, we have the greatest capacity for self-defense of any country in history. There should be no obstacle so insurmountable in providing you the best care & support in return. Today we rededicate ourselves to meet that promise.

The @SenMajLdr just shot down a bipartisan bill to protect the #MuellerInvestigation—an investigation that has already found 8 people guilty & put 4 behind bars. This is not a time for politics. We must stand up for the rule of law.

We’re at the @NatImmForum this morning talking about our bipartisan work to fix our broken immigration immigration system and uphold American values. Watch my conversation with @SenatorLankford live: https://t.co/G5HrcAPQWP #LeadingtheWay18 https://t.co/FScqaAjNGj

At @ColoradoStateU, 1500 students are facing GI Bill benefit issues due to a VA IT problem. Student veterans across the country have not received housing payments for weeks. I’ve called on @SecWilkie to take action until every veteran receives benefits. https://t.co/VcIQGlNcIp

Grateful for the opportunity to work in a bipartisan way to fix our immigration system. There's still so much more work to be done & we need more partners like @SenatorLankford who are willing to step across the aisle to find solutions, showing we are nation of both laws & grace. https://t.co/2GB4EYlamI
